summary: Cornwell is mentioned in one document (144-10001-10249) as co-authoring a report with Klein regarding their interview with Sgt. Nicholas B. Stevenson, USAF. The report concerned a facility able to collect the Lisbon-Tangier link. Julia Wetzel (NSA) visited the House Select Committee on Assassinations to review this report and ensured its classification.
significance: Cornwell's significance lies in their involvement in interviewing Sgt. Nicholas B. Stevenson regarding a facility able to collect the Lisbon-Tangier link, and the subsequent review and classification of the report by the House Select Committee on Assassinations. The specific role Cornwell played in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated but is related to the investigation of communications intelligence.
